title: Honoring Dr. Stuart Steiner upon the occasion of his retirement after 45 years of distinguished service as President of Genesee Community College
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION honoring Dr. Stuart Steiner upon the occasion of
his retirement after 45 years of distinguished service as  President  of
Genesee Community College

WHEREAS,  New  York State's commitment to education is unparalleled; its
history and stature are secured by the superlative caliber of its educa-
tional professionals and the students they inspire; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of this Legislative Body to  acknowledge  the
significant milestones in the distinguished careers of those outstanding
educational leaders, whose dedication and achievements have been instru-
mental  in developing character and academic excellence in those attend-
ing higher education in the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions, this Legislative Body is justly proud to honor Dr.
Stuart Steiner upon the occasion of his retirement  after  45  years  of
distinguished  service  as  President of Genesee Community College to be
observed at a celebration on Saturday, April 2, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, Having served Genesee Community College since the late  1960s
with  dedication  and distinction, Dr. Stuart Steiner will retire at the
end of the academic year in the Spring of 2011; he will leave  with  the
distinction of being one of the longest serving Community College Presi-
dents in the United States; and
  WHEREAS,  Through  Dr. Stuart Steiner's experienced vision and skilled
leadership, Genesee Community College has earned a reputation for excel-
lence and innovation throughout this Nation and abroad; and
  WHEREAS, Recognized nationally and internationally for  his  knowledge
and expertise in higher education, Dr. Stuart Steiner has been frequent-
ly  called upon for advice, assistance and numerous conference presenta-
tions by leading organizations  such  as  the  American  Association  of
Community  Colleges,  the Association of Community College Trustees, the
State University of New York, and the Middle States Commission on Higher
Education; and
  WHEREAS, Dr. Stuart Steiner has served the local community with  equal
vigor  and  passion,  and  has served with distinction on numerous local
charitable and economic development boards and committees; and
  WHEREAS, This exceptional leader's service, accomplishments and  dedi-
cation  have  been  recognized  with  acclaim  through the University of
Texas's Community  College  Leadership  Award,  the  Kellogg  Foundation
Transformational  Leadership  Award,  the  SUNY  Faculty Council Distin-
guished Service Award, and the Association of Community College Trustees
Northeast Region Chief Executive Award; and
  WHEREAS, Educational Administrators provide a  tremendous  service  to
the future of our State and Nation, particularly Dr. Stuart Steiner, who
has  inspired  the lives of two generations of Genesee Community College
students in their educational journeys and ensuring  their  success  for
years to come; and
  WHEREAS,  Dr. Stuart Steiner has clearly had an enduring impact on the
students, both past and present, of the Genesee  Community  College,  as
well  as  on  the community-at-large, and accordingly merits recognition
and applause for 45 years of impressive dedication to others; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their
profession, certainly have earned the recognition and  applause  of  all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Dr. Stuart Steiner upon the occasion of his retirement  as  Presi-

dent of the Genesee Community College, and to wish him continued success
in all of his future endeavors; and be it further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Dr. Stuart Steiner.
